<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff496aaa7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 2:8. The alien must comply with restrictions on pursuing a course of study at public schools</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff496aad7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 2:9. The alien must be enrolled in a "full course of study" at the school</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff49b8c47c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 2:11. <heading>Chapter 5. The L-1 Visa Category</heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59be5b7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135162" format="cent_r">Research References</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Ie737e15194ed11daa65bf1cbbf9e1f07" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">Introduction</cite.query></heading>
<heading>I. Basic Information About the L Category</heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59be5e7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:1. General requirements</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59be617c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:2. Duration of stay</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59be647c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:3. Application process</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59be677c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:4. Special conditions</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59be6a7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:5. Family members of the L-1 nonimmigrant</cite.query></heading>
<heading>II. Basic Requirements for Obtaining L-1 Status</heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59be6d7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:6. The employee must have worked abroad for the overseas company for a continuous period of one year in the preceding three years</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e5607c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:7. The overseas company must be related to the U.S. company in a specific manner</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e5637c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:8. The company must be a qualifying organization</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e5667c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:9. The employee to be transferred must have been employed abroad in an "executive" or "managerial" position or a position involving "specialized knowledge"</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e5697c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:10. The employee must be coming to the U.S. company to work in an executive, managerial, or specialized knowledge capacity</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e56c7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:11. The employee must be qualified for the position by virtue of his or her prior education and experience</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e56f7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:12. An export control license must be obtained when controlled technology is involved</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e5727c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:13. The L-1 alien must intend to depart the United States upon completion of his or her authorized stay (including extensions), but may also pursue permanent residence at the same time</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e5757c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:14. Special requirements applicable to Canadian and Mexican intracompany transferees under NAFTA</cite.query></heading>
<heading>III. Basic Questions to Answer before Proceeding with an L-1 Case</heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e5787c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:15. Has the employee been employed with the company abroad for a continuous period of at least one year within the last three years?</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e57b7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:16. Is the company abroad for which the employee works related to the U.S. company in the correct way?</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff59e57e7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:17. Is the employee to be transferred currently working in an executive, managerial, or specialized knowledge capacity with the company abroad and will he or she work in one of these capacities with your company in the U.S.?</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5a0c727c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:18. Will the foreign national be exposed to technology that is controlled under federal law, has an export control license been obtained?</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5a0c757c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:19. Miscellaneous points to remember about the L-1 category</cite.query></heading>
<heading>IV. Procedures for Obtaining L-1 Status</heading>
<heading>A. Overview</heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5a0c787c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 5:20. The process for obtaining L-1 status (generally)</cite.query></heading>
<heading>B. Preparation of the USCIS Petition</heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="I4e2b64c2ce1611dabfbfdfd86a3bd718" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">Introduction</cite.query></heading>
<heading>I. Basic Information about the H-2B Category</heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5acfda7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:1. General requirements</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5acfdd7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:2. Duration of stay</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6d27c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:3. Application process</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6d57c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:4. Special conditions</cite.query></heading>
<heading>II. Basic Requirements for Obtaining H-2B Status</heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6d87c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:5. H-2B status can be sought for a single alien, or a group of aliens, and the identity of the aliens must generally be known in advance</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6db7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:6. Petitioner must be U.S. employer or U.S. agent</cite.query></heading>
<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6de7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:7. Certification must be sought from DOL</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6e17c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:8. The employer's need for the H-2B worker must be temporary</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6e47c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:9. The employer must intend to employ the alien temporarily</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6e77c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:10. The alien can be skilled or unskilled, beneficiary must meet any specific job requirements</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6ea7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:11. The alien must intend to remain in the U.S. temporarily and must maintain a foreign residence</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5af6ed7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:12. An admission slot within the annual cap must be available</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1de27c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:13. The beneficiary must be a national of a country designated for H-2B participation</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1de57c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:14. The employer may not require beneficiary to pay fee as condition of employment</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1de87c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:15. The employer must be willing to pay the reasonable cost of return transportation for the worker in specified circumstances</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1deb7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:16. The employer must agree to make certain employment-related notifications</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1dee7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:17. The employee must agree to meet certain departure requirements</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1df17c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:18. Is there a shortage of unemployed U.S. workers who are capable of performing the labor?</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1df47c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:19. Is the employer's need for the alien's services temporary?</cite.query></heading>

<heading>A. Overview</heading>

<heading>B. Obtaining Labor Certification From DOL</heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b1dfa7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:21. The labor certification process (generally)</cite.query></heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff5b44fb7c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 7:26. Labor certifications for H-2B entertainers</cite.query></heading>

<heading>A. Requirements For All Three Preference Groups</heading>

<heading><cite.query w-ref-type="ZZ" w-normalized-cite="Iff60ea517c8f11da9de6e47d6d5aa7a5" w-pub-number="135081" format="cent_r">§ 16:7. In most cases, the Department of Labor (DOL) must certify that U.S. workers are unavailable to fill the position</cite.query></heading>
